patterns: What courses can I apply for?
responses: TAR UMT offers Pre-U, Diploma, Undergraduate and Postgraduate programmes across faculties like Engineering, Business, Computing & IT, Built Environment, Communication, Creative Arts, Hospitality and Social Sciences. For the complete and current list, see the Programmes section on the Admissions site.

patterns: What documents are needed for application?
Do I need MUET or IELTS?
responses: Apply online via the Admissions portal. Requirements vary by programme and may include academic results and English proficiency (e.g., MUET/IELTS). Check the Admissions pages for the latest steps, intakes and document checklist. If you need help, contact the Department of Admissions & Credit Evaluation via their Contact Us page.

patterns: How to check my application status?
responses: You can review programme details, fees and intakes on the site, then track or enquire about your application/enrolment status through the Admissions pages (Application & Enrolment Status Enquiry).

patterns: How much is the tuition fee?
Where can I find fee details?
responses: Tuition and other fees differ by programme and level. Refer to the latest official fee schedule on the Admissions/Fees section for an accurate breakdown by intake and semester.

TAR UMT offers scholarships and financial aid, including the Merit Scholarship (tuition fee waiver up to 100% for outstanding Malaysian students), plus other schemes. Eligibility and dates vary, so check the Scholarships/Financial Aid pages for current details and forms.

patterns: How do I apply for housing?
responses: On-campus hostel is offered at selected campuses; off-campus options are listed by the Department of Student Affairs (DSA). See the Accommodation pages to view on-campus info and the DSA Accommodation Listing (filter by campus) for verified off-campus choices and contact details.

patterns: How do international students apply for hostel?
responses: International students who want on-campus hostel should submit the hostel application via the Student Intranet. For visa, arrival and housing guidance, contact the Department of International Student Office (DISO).

The TAR UMT Library’s office hours are typically 8:30am–5:30pm (Mon–Fri), with services like borrowing, study spaces and online databases. For up-to-date hours, borrowing rules, remote access and contacts, visit the Library site and its Opening Hours, Circulation Services, FAQs and Contact pages.

TAR UMT has a Main Campus and several branch campuses. Not all programmes run at every campus. Visit the Campuses/Contact pages to view addresses, available programmes and key contacts for each location.

patterns: How do I contact the university?
responses: For general and unit-specific contacts, use the official Contact Us pages. For Admissions, see the Department of Admissions & Credit Evaluation contact page for phone, WhatsApp and email; for Student Affairs (financial aid, accommodation, transport), use DSA’s contact page; for Library, use library@tarc.edu.my or the Library Contact page.

Check the official Academic Calendar for intake start dates, registration deadlines, study weeks and examination periods. Calendars are published per academic year and programme category (e.g., Undergraduate/Postgraduate, Foundation).

Payment options and steps are listed under Finance/Payments on the official site and student portal. Refer there for available methods (e.g., online channels), bank details, deadlines, and receipt/proof-of-payment instructions.

patterns: How do I access the student portal?
responses: Access the Student Portal with your student ID. You can view your timetable, results, fee statements and announcements. Use the password reset function if you cannot sign in, and contact IT Helpdesk if issues persist.

For visa, insurance, arrival and housing, contact the Department of International Student Office (DISO). Requirements and timelines vary by nationality and programme; the DISO Contact Information page lists address, phone and email.

Transport and parking details (maps, public transport options, shuttle info and parking guidance) are provided on campus pages and DSA notices. Check your campus page and DSA updates for the latest arrangements.
Student Affairs lists the range of co-curricular courses, clubs and societies, with recruitment dates and contacts. See the DSA pages for current club directory and how to join.
For IT or network issues, contact the IT Helpdesk. Provide your student ID and error details. Check service notices on the portal; use the self-service password reset or visit the helpdesk if needed.
Confidential counselling is available to students via Student Affairs/Counselling Services. Book an appointment through the published channels; emergency contacts are also listed there.

Facilities such as gym, courts and fields are available (availability varies by campus). Check your campus Sports Centre or Student Affairs pages for booking procedures, opening hours and access policies.

Convocation dates, venue, gown rental and tickets are announced on the Graduation/Convocation pages and via student email. Ensure all academic and financial requirements are met before submitting your graduation application.
TAR UMT provides industry-relevant education with strong graduate outcomes. Many programmes carry relevant accreditation. Visit the About pages for milestones, recognitions and collaborations.
Hello! 👋 How can I help you today?
Hi there! Ask me anything about TAR UMT admissions, programmes, fees, or campus life.
Hey! 😊 Looking for info about courses, scholarships, or student life?
Sorry, I didn’t quite get that. Could you try asking in another way?
Hmm, I’m not sure about that. Please check the relevant page on the official website for more details.
